item.title: Clicking button giving you item Rep++
item.dc:creator: @CodeBest CodeBest
item.description:
@CodeBest wrote:

are you on PI? if yes then it would be clickingbuttons. im not great with interfaces but I think when you add a button in the interface client-sided, then just click it in-game and it should print out on your “run.bat”. Then just add the case into your clickingbuttons

item.title: Clicking button giving you item Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Brandontan Brandontan
item.description:
@Brandontan wrote:

client sided i have an interface that opens up and you can choose what two options you want for voting, coins, or misc
here is the method clientsided

[code] public static void vote(TextDrawingArea[] TDA){

	RSInterface tab = addTabInterface(19050);
	addSprite(19051, 4, "Vote/CUSTOM");
	addHoverButton(19052, "Vote/CUSTOM", 0, 63, 44, "@red@Misc reward", 0, 19053, 1);
	addHoveredButton(19053, "Vote/CUSTOM", 1, 63, 44, 19054);
	addHoverButton(19055, "Vote/CUSTOM", 2, 39, 45, "@red@Cash reward", 0, 19056, 1);
	addHoveredButton(19056, "Vote/CUSTOM", 3, 39, 45, 19057);
	tab.totalChildren(5);
	tab.child(0, 19051, 80, 95);
	tab.child(1, 19052, 300, 155);
	tab.child(2, 19053, 300, 155);
	tab.child(3, 19055, 150, 155);
	tab.child(4, 19056, 150, 155);
}[/code]

where would i go to basically add where you click the button, you get the item. would it be in action handler? clickingbuttons? i’m kind of confused if someone could help out that would be great. also would i add case with the button id in there?

Read full topic
item.source: Clicking button giving you item Rep++
